This could be due to something the character did or said, or just because the beings were already unhappy with their position.

ShortDesc: After another character makes a social check, suffer 3 strain to take an Interjection incidental: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Vigilance check to add :suc: or :fai: equal to :suc: and :adv: or :thr: equal to :adv: on the check.
Once per encounter, may add :wh: to a check using Brawn or Agility made by an ally in short range. :lsp: add :suc: and :dsp: add :thr:.
LongDesc: Once per encounter, when an ally within short range attempts a skill check using the Brawn or Agility characteristic, the character may roll :wh:. Each :lsp: adds :suc: to the target's check; however, each :dsp: adds :thr: to the target's check.

ShortDesc: Once per session when an ally would suffer a Critical Injury, may take an It’s Not That Bad action; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Medicine check to stop the ally from gaining the Critical Injury.
LongDesc: Once per game session, when an ally is about to suffer a critical injury, the character can take an It's Not That Bad incidental to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Medicine check. If successful, the ally does not gain the Critical Injury and does not suffer any of its normal effects (although the attack that caused the Critical Injury still deals its damage as normal).

ShortDesc: Once per session, perfectly recall an important fact previously learned as if a Destiny Point had been spent.
Once per round when driving a vehicle, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.
LongDesc: Once per round when piloting a vehicle using the Piloting (Planetary) skill, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.

ShortDesc: Decrease the :adv: cost to activate the Blast quality on any weapon used by 1 to a minimum of 1.
LongDesc: The character decreases the :adv: cost to activate the Blast quality on any weapon he uses by 1 to a minimum of 1. This includes the cost to activate the Blast quality if the weapon misses.

ShortDesc: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of next Leadership check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Leadership check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Piloting (Planetary) or Gunnery check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Planetary) or Gunnery check.

ShortDesc: Once per session. may reroll any 1 Cool or Leadership check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Leadership check.

ShortDesc: Upon unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, may spend :adv: :adv: per rank of Overwhelm Defenses. Reduce the defense in the targeted zone by 1 for every :adv: :adv: spent.
LongDesc: Upon making an unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, the character may spend :adv: :adv: per rank of Overwhelm Defenses. Reduce the defense rating in the defense zone targeted by the attack for the remainder of the encounter by 1 for every :adv: :adv: spent.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Physical Training to Athletics and Resilience checks.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Physical Training to his Athletics and Resilience checks.

ShortDesc: Take an Improved Plausible Deniability action: make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Coercion check to convince one bystander per rank of Plausible Deniability to depart quietly.
Whenever any character’s Duty would increase, it increases by an additional 1 per rank of Positive Spin.
Whenever any character’s Duty would increase, it increases by an additional 1 per rank of Positive Spin.
Increase Blast damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades by +1 per rank of Powerful Blast.
LongDesc: The character increases the Blast quality damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades he uses by 1 per rank of Powerful Blast.

ShortDesc: Once per session, make one skill check using Agility rather than the Characteristic linked to that skill.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Agility, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his agility is helping him overcome this challenge.

ShortDesc: On a successful Knowledge check, character and allies gain automatic :adv: per rank of Researcher on checks to act on those facts until the end of his next turn.
When using a weapon with the Blast quality, spend :adv: to exclude 1 target that would be affected by the explosion, up to ranks in Selective Detonation.
LongDesc: When using weapons with the Blast quality or explosive devices, the character may spend :adv: to exclude one target that would normally be affected by the explosion. Multiple targets may be excluded in this manner, but the total number may not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation. The character may also spend :tri: to exclude multiple targets, as long as the total number of targets excluded does not exceed his ranks in Selective Detonation.

ShortDesc: Allies within short range of the vehicle add :bl: to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies within close range add :bl: :bl: instead.
LongDesc: When in a starship or vehicle with functional corns, allies within short range add :bl: to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies within close range add :bl: :bl: instead. This talent operates on planetary scale, not personal scale.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: to all Stealth checks unless the opposition is immune to Force powers.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Sleight of Mind to his Stealth checks unless the being attempting to detect the character is immune to Force Powers.

ShortDesc: At the start of each session, gain 100 credits for each rank of Sound Investments.
LongDesc: At the beginning of each game session, the character gains credits equal to his ranks in Sound Investments times 100. How this money is earned is up to the player and CM, and could be actual investments, business dealings, or even a small legal or illegal side business. The GM can also decide that the current events of the adventure may make these funds temporarily unavailable.

ShortDesc: Slimpacks heal 1 addilional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization.
LongDesc: Whenever the character uses a stimpack, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization. The sixth stimpack and beyond each day still have no effect.

ShortDesc: Treat thrown weapons as if they had 1 greater range.
LongDesc: Characters with the Strong Arm talent treat thrown weapons as if they had one step greater range, to a maximum of medium range.

ShortDesc: When assisting an ally with a Charm, Deception, Leadership or Negotiation check, add automatic :adv: per rank of Supporting Evidence.
Melee and Ranged (Heavy) become career skills.
LongDesc: Melee and Ranged (Heavy) become career skills.

ShortDesc: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion.
LongDesc: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This may be performed out of turn. This incidental occurs after the character determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

ShortDesc: When activating Time to Go, allow 1 engaged ally to also perform an out of turn Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion.
LongDesc: When activating Time to Co, the character may allow one ally he is engaged with to also perform an out of turn Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion. This incidental occurs after the ally determines he would be hit by the blast, but before damage is applied.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may perform a True Aim maneuver to gain benefits of aiming and upgrade combat check once per rank of True Aim.
LongDesc: Once per round, before the character makes a ranged attack, he may perform a True Aim maneuver. By performing this maneuver, the character gains all the benefits for aiming and also upgrades his attack roll once per rank of True Aim.

ShortDesc: When an incoming social check generates :thr: :thr: or :des:, may suffer 1 strain as an incidental to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion on speaker.
If a Critical Injury roll is 1 or reduced to 1, do not receive the critical injury.
LongDesc: If the percentile roll made when the character receives a Critical Injury is 1 or is reduced to 1, the character does not receive the Critical Injury and suffers none of the effects.

ShortDesc: Gunnery and Piloting (Planetary) become career skills.
LongDesc: Gunnery and Piloting (Planetary) become career skills.

ShortDesc: Knowledge (Core Worlds) and Knowledge (Outer Rim) become career skills.
LongDesc: Knowledge (Core Worlds) and Knowledge (Outer Rim) become career skills.

ShortDesc: Once per session, make one skill check using Presence rather than the characteristic linked to that skill.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Presence, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his social ability is helping him overcome this challenge.
Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

ShortDesc: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit.
LongDesc: After a successful attack with a non-starship/vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Intellect to one hit of the attack.

ShortDesc: When wearing armor, increase total soak value by 1.
LongDesc: When wearing armor, the character increases his total soak value by one.

ShortDesc: When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1.
LongDesc: When wearing armor with a soak value of two or higher, the character increases his defense by one.

ShortDesc: Patients regain 1 additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist when they recover wounds from bacta tanks or long term care.
LongDesc: Patients under the character's supervision regain one additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist each time they recover a wound while recovering in a Bacta tank or under supervised medical conditions or long-term care.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may take a Bad Motivator action; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check to cause one targeted device to spontaneously fail.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may take a Bad Motivator action to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check. If successful, one device (subject to the GM's approval) spontaneously fails due to the character's involvement, or because it was about to fail anyway and the character noticed it (this is the character's decision).

ShortDesc: When the character recovers strain at the end of the encounter, he may add :wh: per Force rating. He recovers additional strain equal to :ldsp: generated.
LongDesc: Add one damage per rank of Barrage to one hit of successful Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery attacks with nonstarship/vehicle weapons at long or extreme range.

ShortDesc: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.
LongDesc: When looking to purchase illegal, exotic, or black market goods, the character may decrease an item's rarity by one level per rank in Black Market Contacts. For each level an item's rarity is decreased, its cost increases by 50% of its base cost.

ShortDesc: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50 percent of base cost per reduction.
LongDesc: When the character recovers from strain at the end of each encounter, he may roll his Force rating in Force dice. He regains additional strain equal to the :lsp: rolled.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from poisons, venoms, or toxins. Reduce duration of ongoing poisons by 1 round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of 1.
LongDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from the effects of poisons, venoms, and other toxins. Reduce the duration of any related ongoing effects or damage from toxins, venoms, or poisons by one round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of one.

ShortDesc: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard. then until the beginning of the next turn upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Body Guard maneuver to protect one ally he is engaged with. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Body Guard. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting the protected ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

ShortDesc: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove :bk: per rank of Brace from the next Action. This may only remove :bk: added by environmental circumstances.
LongDesc: As a maneuver, the character may Brace himself. This allows a character to remove :bk: per rank of Brace from the next skill check based on changing conditions, inclement weather, unstable surfaces, zero gravity, heavy gravity, or other disruptive physical obstacles that would make a skill check more difficult.

ShortDesc: Once per encounter may take Brilliant Evasion action; select 1 opponent and make Opposed Piloting (Planetary or Space) check to stop opponent from attacking character for rounds equal to Agility.
LongDesc: The character may make the Brilliant Evasion action when piloting a vehicle or starship. The character selects one opponent and makes an Opposed Piloting (Planetary or Space) check If he succeeds, the opponent's vehicle or starship cannot make any attacks against the character's vehicle for a number of rounds equal to the character's Agility. Brilliant Evasion can only be performed once per encounter.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: equal to the character's ranks in Bypass Security from Skullduggery or Computers skill checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank in Codebreaker from checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease difficulty of checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: from any attempt to break codes or decrypt communications equal to his ranks in Codebreaker. In addition, the character decreases the difficulty of Computers or Intellect checks made to break codes or decrypt communications by one. This does not increase with additional ranks of Codebreaker.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add :bl: to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.
LongDesc: Gain :bl: when making Leadership checks (or other checks to inspire, lead, or rally an audience) per rank of Command. Inspired targets also add :bl: per rank to any subsequent Discipline checks they make over the next twenty-four hours. This does not increase with additional ranks of Command.

ShortDesc: May decrease difficulty of Deiscipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence
LongDesc: The character may decrease the difficulty of any Discipline check to avoid the effects of fear by one level per rank of Confidence. If he decreases the difficulty to zero, he does not have to make a Discipline check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, take Contraption action; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check to fashion a device to solve a current problem using just the tools and parts on hand.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character can take a Contraption action. With a successful Hard(:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check, the character can fashion a device to solve a current problem using the tools and parts on hand. This device must be approved by the GM and functions for the duration of the current encounter only. Those tools are destroyed in the process. :tri: may be spent to allow the tools to be recovered to be reused later.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Convincing Demeanor from any Deception or Skullduggery check.

ShortDesc: When targeted by a combat check, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add :fai: equal to ranks in Coordination to check.
LongDesc: When targeted by a combat Check, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add :fai: equal to her ranks in Coordination to the check.

ShortDesc: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffers 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.
LongDesc: The character may voluntarily increase the difficulty of a combat check by one to deal a crippling blow. If he succeeds and deals damage to the target's wound threshold, the target suffers one strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.

ShortDesc: May add 2 additional hard points to Signature Vehicle.
Remove :bk: per rank of Cyberneticist from checks to build, repair, and install Cybernetic implants. Cybernetics cost 50% less.
Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half Agility (rounded up) to one hit of successful attack made with ship or vehiclemounted weaponry.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half his Agility rating (rounded up) to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to Agility (rounded up) to one hit of successful attack made with ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to his Agility rating to one hit of a successful attack made by ship or vehicle mounted weaponry. This replaces the normal ability for Dead to Rights.

ShortDesc: When acquired, choose 1 combat skill. Add damage equal to ranks in that skill to one hit of successful attack made using that skill.
LongDesc: Each time the character gains a rank of Deadly Accuracy, he must choose one combat skill. The character may add his basic training ranks in that combat skill as additional damage to one hit of a successful attack made with that skill with non-starship/vehicle weapons. He cannot choose the same combat skill twice.

ShortDesc: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6.
LongDesc: Each rank permanently increases a single characteristic of the player's choice by one point. This cannot bring a characteristic above six.

ShortDesc: Increase defense of vehicle or starship being piloted by 1 per rank of Defensive Driving.
LongDesc: Any vehicle the character pilots has its defense rating on all zones increased by one per rank of Defensive Driving.

ShortDesc: When defending computer systems, add :bk: per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponent’s checks.
LongDesc: When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion (or when an opponent attempts to slice a computer I owned or programmed by the character), the character adds :bk: equal to his rank of Defensive Slicing to his opponent's checks

ShortDesc: When defending computer systems, add :bk: per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponent’s checks.
LongDesc: When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion, the character upgrades the difficulty of an opponent's dice pool a number of times equal to his rank of Defensive Slicing. This replaces the usual benefits from Defensive Slicing.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may perform Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Defensive Stance.
LongDesc: One per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Defensive Stance maneuver to assume a defensive stance against incoming melee attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Defensive Stance. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all melee combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character in this way.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Deft Maker from checks to repair, modify, construct, or program droids. Reduce the material cost to craft droids by 50%.
After hitting with combat check, may spend :adv: :adv: to disorient target for number of rounds equal to ranks in disorient.
LongDesc: After hitting with a combat check, the character may spend :adv: :adv: to disorient his foe (see page 218). Disoriented targets add :bk: to all skill checks. The target is disoriented for a number of rounds equal to the attacker's ranks in Disorient.

ShortDesc: When targeted by a combat check, may perform a dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dogde, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.
LongDesc: When targeted by a combat check (ranged or melee) the character may choose to immediately perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the difficulty of the combat check by that number. The number of strain suffered cannot exceed his ranks in Dodge.

ShortDesc: May reduce any Critical Injury suffered by 10 per rank of Durable to a minimum of 1.
LongDesc: The character may reduce a Critical Injury result he suffers by 10 per rank of Durable, to a minimum of one.

ShortDesc: Gain +1 soak value.
LongDesc: Character gains + 1 soak value per rank of Enduring

ShortDesc: May suffer 1 strain to use Energy Transfer maneuver to power up an unpowered device or replenish exhausted ammunition for an energy weapon.
Gain the ability to use emergency repair patches to heal. Additionally, can be healed with Mechanics check.
Remove :bk: per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find tracks or track targets. Decrease time to track a target by half.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find or follow tracks. Survival checks made to track targets take 50% less time than normal. This does not decrease with additional ranks of Expert Tracker.

ShortDesc: After making a Mechanics of Computers check, may suffer strain up to ranks in Eye for Detail to convert that many :suc: to :adv:.

Once per session, may perform a Familiar Suns maneuver; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Outer Rim) or (Core Worlds) check to reveal the current type of planetary environment and other useful information.
LongDesc: Once per game session the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Outer Rim) or Knowledge (Core Worlds) check. If successful, the character is familiar with the type of planetary environment he finds himself in. He knows whether the planet is likely to be inhabited and, if so, where habitation could be found. He also knows about unusual environmental effects, hostile predators, or sources of potential profit.

ShortDesc: Upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made in the presence of Signature Vehicle once.
Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of successful attacks made using Brawl or Melee skills.
LongDesc: The character deals + 1 damage to one hit on all successful Brawl and Melee checks per rank of Feral Strength.

ShortDesc: Take the Field Commander action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check. A number of allies equal to Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free maneuver.
LongDesc:
The character may take a Field Commander action.
By successfully passing an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check, a number of allies equal to his Presence may immediately suffer one strain to perform one maneuver. This does not count against the number of maneuvers they may perform in their turn. If there are any questions as to the order in which allies act, the character using Field Commander is the final arbitrator

ShortDesc: Field Commander action affects allies equal to double Presence, and may spend :tri: to allow allies to suffer 1 strain and perform 1 free action instead.
LongDesc: When taking a Field Commander action, the character may affect allies equal to twice his Presence. In addition, he may spend :tri: generated on his Leadership checks to allow one ally to suffer one strain to perform an action, rather than a maneuver.

ShortDesc: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce 1 additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.
LongDesc: Whenever a character reduces the amount of strain a starship or vehicle suffers, he reduces one additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.

ShortDesc: Remove up to :bk: :bk: from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.
LongDesc: Remove up to :bk: :bk: from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

ShortDesc: Gain +1 Force Rating.
LongDesc: Each rank permanently increases Force rating by one.

ShortDesc: When making a Melee or Brawl check, suffer a number of strain to upgrade the attack an equal number of times. The strain suffered may not exceed ranks in Frenzied Attack.
LongDesc: When making a Melee or Brawl combat check, the character may suffer a number of strain, then upgrade the ability of his combat check by that number. The number cannot exceed his ranks in Frenzied Attack.

ShortDesc: Take a Full Throttle action; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Piloting check to increase a vehicle’s top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.
LongDesc: The character may push a ship or vehicle past its limits of speed. He may perform the Full Throttle action, attempting a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Piloting check With success, the ship's top speed increases by one for a number of rounds equal to Cunning. The ship still cannot perform actions or maneuvers it could not perform normally (i.e. actions that have a minimum speed requirement).

ShortDesc: Suffer 1 strain to attempt Full throttle as a maneuver and decrease its difficulty to Average (:pu: :pu:).
LongDesc: The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver. In addition, the difficulty of Full Throttle is reduced to Average (:pu: :pu:)

ShortDesc: When performing Full Throttle, top speed increases by 2 instead of 1.
LongDesc: When the character successfully performs Full Throttle, the ship's top speed increases by two for a number of rounds equal to his Cunning, instead of one.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation checks. Astrogation checks take half normal time.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Galaxy Mapper from all Astrogation checks. In addition, Astrogation checks take 50% less time. This does not increase with multiple ranks of Galaxy Mapper.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Gearhead from Meehanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Gearhead from all Mechanics checks. In addition, the credit cost to add mods to attachments decreases by 50% . This does not increase with multiple ranks of Gearhead.

ShortDesc: May spend :adv: :adv: from Charm or Negotiation check to upgrade ability of a single ally’s subsequent Social Interaction check against the target a number of times equal to ranks in Good Cop.
LongDesc: The character may spend :adv: :adv: from a Charm or Negotiation check to upgrade the ability of a ally’s single subsequent Social Interaction skill Check against the same target in the same encounter. Upgrade the ability a number of times equal to the character's ranks in Good Cop. A Single check may only benefit from one use of Good Cop.

ShortDesc: Once per round. may perform the Grapple maneuver. Until the beginning of character's next turn. Foes must spend 2 maneuvers instead of 1 to move from engaged to short range.
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may perform the Grapple maneuver. Until the beginning of her next turn, enemleS must spend two maneuvers instead of one maneuver to move from engaged range to short range of her.

ShortDesc: Gain +1 Strain Threshold.
LongDesc: Each rank of Grit increases a character's strain threshold by one.

ShortDesc: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action; make a Daunting (:pu: :pu: :pu: :pu:) Discipline check to remove status. Difficulty reduced per rank of Hard Headed.
LongDesc: The character may perform the Hard Headed action. On any turn in which the character is staggered or disoriented, he may perform the Hard Headed action (this action may be specifically performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions when staggered). He makes a Daunting (:pu: :pu: :pu: :pu:) Discipline check If he succeeds, he is no longer staggered or disoriented. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per additional rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:)

ShortDesc: When incapacitated due to strain exceeding threshold, may take a more difficult Hard Headed action to reduce strain to 1 below threshold.
LongDesc: The character may use his Hard Headed action to recover from being incapacitated due to exceeding his strain threshold. On his next turn after being incapacitated, he may make a Formidable(:pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu:) Discipline check as his Hard Headed action (this action can specifically be performed even though he is normally barred from performing actions). If he succeeds, decrease his strain to one below his strain threshold. The difficulty of this check decreases by one per rank of Hard Headed, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

ShortDesc: When recovering strain after an encounter, may spend :adv: up to ranks in Hard-Boiled to recover 1 wound per :adv: spend.
LongDesc: When making a check to recover strain at the end of an encounter, the character may Spend :adv: to recover one wound. :adv: spent this way cannot exceed her ranks in Hard-Boiled.

ShortDesc: Allies within short range add :bl: to Perception or Vigilance checks. Engaged allies add :bl: :bl:.
LongDesc: Allies within close range of the character add :bl: to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies engaged with him add :bl: :bl: instead.

ShortDesc: May spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Brawn or Agility checks until the end of the encounter.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Brawn or Agility related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

ShortDesc: Gain hidden storage in vehicles or equipment that holds items with total encumberance equal to ranks in Hidden Storage.
LongDesc: Any large equipment, vehicle, or droid that the character owns has one or more hidden compartments for smuggling appropriately sized gear. The number of compartments is up to the player, but cannot be enough to hold a total encumbrance value of items more than the character's ranks in Hidden Storage. The size of the compartments are proportional to the size of the vehicle or droid in question. Most humanoid droids can only hold items equivalent in size to a one-handed weapon, whereas a silhouette 4 starship could conceal humanoids within its compartments. Any checks to detect these compartments have a Formidable ( :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: :pu: ) difficulty.

ShortDesc: Increase the difficulty of next Gunnery check by 1. If check deals damage, target starship or vehicle suffers system strain equal to speed when it moves until the end of the encounter.
LongDesc: The character may voluntarily increase the difficulty of a Gunnery combat check once to inflict a hindering shot on a vehicle If she succeeds and deals damage to the target vehicle’s hull trauma threshold, the vehicle suffers system strain equal to its current Speed Whenever it moves until the end of the encounter.

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Hold Together incidental immediately after vehicle or starship takes damage to turn it into system strain.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to make a Hold Together incidental immediately after a vehicle or starship he has repaired this encounter takes damage. The character explains why the apparently serious damage was in fact superficial, and the damage from the attack becomes system strain instead.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Hunter to all checks when interacting with beast or animals (including combat checks). Add +10 to Critical Injury results against beasts or animals per rank of Hunter.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Hunter to all skill checks when interacting with wild beasts and animals, including combat checks. Add +10 per rank to all Critical Injury rolls against animals per rank of Hunter.

ShortDesc: Upgrade difficulty of checks to identify character once per rank of Indistinguishable.
LongDesc: The character's appearance is so common that people have a hard time identifying distinguishing traits. Opposing characters upgrade the difficulty of any checks made to identify him once per rank of Indistinguishable.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may reveal a contact who can shed light on a chosen subject.
LongDesc:
Once per game session, the character may reveal a contact who possesses information on a par‘ticular subject of her Choice.

When the character does this, she must explain how she knows this contact and how the contact can shed light on the matter in question The contact shouId be available to the PCS, but the CM decides what the contact's expertise might cost.

ShortDesc: Perception and Discipline become career skills.
LongDesc: Perception and Discipline become career skills if they are not already.

ShortDesc: Take the Inspiring Rhetoric action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check. Each :suc: causes 1 ally in close range to recover 1 strain. Spend :adv: to cause 1 affected ally to recover 1 additional strain.
LongDesc: The character may take the Inspiring Rhetoric action: making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Leadership check. For each :suc:, one ally within close range recovers one strain. For each :adv:, one ally benefiting from Inspiring Rhetoric recovers one additional strain.

ShortDesc: Each ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains :bl: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Leadership.
LongDesc: Each ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains :bl: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to the character's ranks in Leadership; this does not stack with itself.

ShortDesc: Suffer 1 strain to perform Inspiring Rhetoric as a maneuver, not an action.
LongDesc: The character may voluntarily suffer 1 strain to perform Inspiring Rhetoric as a maneuver instead of an action.

ShortDesc: Perform an Intense Focus maneuver; suffer 1 strain and upgrade the ability of the next skill check once.
LongDesc: Before making a skill check, the character may perform the Intense Focus maneuver. The character suffers one strain to upgrade the ability of the skill check once.

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Presence rating.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to his Presence rating.

ShortDesc: May suffer a number of strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade the difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Intimidating.
LongDesc: When attempting a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to downgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating. When the character is the target of a Coercion check, the character may suffer a number of strain to upgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to the strain suffered. This number cannot exceed his ranks in Intimidating.

ShortDesc: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add :bl: or remove :bk: per rank of lnventor.
LongDesc: When constructing new items or modifying existing attachments (see Chapter V: Gear and Equipment), the character may choose to add :bl:  or remove :bk: from the check per rank of Inventor.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Iron body from Coordination and Resilience checks. Reduce the critical rating of unarmed attacks by 1 per rank of Iron Body (to a minimum of 1).
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: per rank of Iron Body From her Coordination and Resilience checks. The critical rating of the character’s unarmed attacks is reduced by 1 per rank of Iron Body, to a minimum of 1.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may stand from seated or prone as an incidental.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may stand up from prone or a seated position as an Incidental.

ShortDesc: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use.
LongDesc: The character chooses one personal weapon or piece of armor per rank of Jury Rigged. He may increase the damage of the weapon by one; decrease the Advantage cost on its Critical, or any single other effect by one to a minimum of one; or increase armor's ranged or melee defense by one. Alternatively, he can decrease the encumbrance of the item by two to a minimum of one. The bonus only applies so long as the character is using the item. If the item is ever lost or destroyed, the character may apply Jury Rigged to a new personal weapon or piece or armor.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Kill With Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Kill with Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks the character attempts.

ShortDesc: After hitting with a melee attack, may spend :tri: to knock the target prone.
LongDesc: After hitting with a melee attack, the character may knock the target prone by spending a :tri: . If the target is larger than the acting character, it requires one additional :tri: for each silhouette larger.

ShortDesc: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.
LongDesc: Once per game session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, the character may reduce its rarity by one step per rank of Know Somebody.

ShortDesc: When acquired, choose Knowledge skill. When making that skill check, may spend :tri: result to gain additional successes equal to ranks in Knowledge Specialization.
LongDesc: When the character first acquires this talent, he may choose one Knowledge skill. When making checks with that skill, he may spend:tri: to gain additional successes equal to his ranks in Knowledge Specialization.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may perform the Know Schematic maneuver; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Knowledge (Education) check. Success grants familiarity with a building or ship’s design.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may spend a maneuver to make a Hard ( :pu: :pu: :pu: ) Knowledge (Education) check. Success means the character is familiar with a building or capital ship's design. He now knows the location of critical components or facilities within the ship or vehicle, as well as his own location. He can also plan unconventional routes around obstacles. Additional :suc:, :adv:, or :tri: results can reveal other useful information at the GM's discretion.

ShortDesc: Signature Vehicle can have a silhouette 1 larger per rank of Larger Project.
Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.
LongDesc: The character adds + 10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury rolls inflicted on opponents.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may mount or dismount a vehicle or beast, or enter a cockpit or weapon station on a vehicle, as an incidental.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may mount or dismount from a vehicle or beast, or slide into the cockpit or weapon station aboard a starship, as an incidental instead of a maneuver.

ShortDesc: When making Mechanics check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Machine Mender.
Once per round, suffer 2 strain to add damage equal to ranks in Coordination to next Brawl check made this turn.
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may suffer 2 strain to add additional damage equal to her ranks in Coordination to one hit of a successful Brawl combat check.

ShortDesc: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of a Medicine check by 1.
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Medicine check by one to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

ShortDesc: When buying or selling goods, or paying off or taking Obligation, may suffer 2 strain to sell for 25% more, buy for 25% less, pay off 1 more Obligation, or take on 1 less.
LongDesc: Before making a check when buying or selling items, or undertaking or paying off Obligation, the character may choose to suffer two strain. If the check succeeds, he sells the item for 25% more than base cost, buys it for 25% less, pays off an additional one Obligation point, or undertakes one less Obligation point.

ShortDesc: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one.
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of the next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:)

ShortDesc: Once per round when piloting a starship, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.
LongDesc: Once per round when piloting a starship (a ship piloted using the Piloting (Space) skill), the character may voluntarily suffer two strain to perform any action as a maneuver instead.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may take a Master Slicer incidental to suffer 2 strain and decrease difficulty of Computers or other slicing checks by 1, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may perform a Master Slicer incidental to suffer two strain and decrease the difficulty of the next Computers or other slicing-related check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

ShortDesc: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of next Astrogation check by 1 to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).
LongDesc: Once per round, the character may suffer two strain to decrease the difficulty of his next Astrogation check by one, to a minimum of Easy (:pu:).

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Intellect or Cunning checks until end of encounter.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Intellect or Cunning related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

ShortDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to his Willpower rating.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Willpower rating.

ShortDesc: Increase cybernetic implant cap by 1 per rank of More Machine than Man.
Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Brawl or Melee check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Brawl or Melee check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Charm or Deception check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Medicine check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Medicine check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Coercion or Streetwise check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Coercion or Streetwise check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Perception or Vigilance check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Perception or Vigilance check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Cool or Negotiation check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Cool or Negotiation check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, reroll any 1 Resilience or Survival check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Resilience or Survival check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Computers or Astrogation check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Computers or Astrogation check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Skulduggery or Stealth check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Skulduggery or Stealth check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Knowledge skill check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Knowledge skill check.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Mechanics check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Mechanics check.

ShortDesc: Upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.
LongDesc: The difficulty of any Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks attempted against the character is upgraded once for each rank of Nobody's Fool.

ShortDesc: As a maneuver, suffer system strain up to vehicle’s highest defense to upgrade the difficulty of target’s next Piloting check that many times.
LongDesc: As a maneuver, the character may inflict a number of System Strain on her vehicle no greater than its highest defense value and choose a vehicle within close range. If the character does so, upgrade the difficulty of the next Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting (Space). Check that the vehicles pilot makes before the end of the encounter once for each system strain inflicted on her craft this way.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel time by half.
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage terrain or environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by 50% (this does not decrease with multiple ranks of Outdoorsman).

ShortDesc: When a combat check made by an engaged foe generates :des: or :thr: :thr: :thr:, may stagger attacker until the end of his next turn.
LongDesc: Whenever an enemy engaged with the character makes a combat check, after the attack is resolved, the character may spend :des: or :thr: :thr: :thr: to stagger the attacker until the end of the attacker's next turn.

ShortDesc: Once per encounter, may use the Overcharge action. Make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Mechanics check. On success, one installed cybernetic provides additional benefits. On :des:, overcharged cybernetic shorts out.
May spend :adv: :adv: or :tri: from Overcharge action to immediately take another action.
May perform the Overcharge action on any number of installed cybernetics. On :des:, one overcharged cybernetic shorts out.
May add :wh: per Force Rating to Charm, Coercion, or Deceit checks :lsp: and :dsp: add :suc: to some checks and :fai: to others.
LongDesc: When the character performs a Charm, Coercion, or Deception check, he may include :wh: equal to his Force rating. Each :lsp: adds :suc: to Charm checks. Each :dsp: adds :suc: to Coercion or Deception checks. However, every :lsp: :lsp: add :fai: to Coercion or Deception checks, and every :dsp: :dsp: add :fai: to Charm checks. This does not apply to targets immune to Force powers.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Planet Mapper from Streetwise or Survival checks used for navigation on a world. Such checks also take half normal time.
LongDesc: The character removed :bk: per rank of Planet Mapper from her Streetwise or Survival checks used to navigate on a world. In addition, such checks take 50% less time (this does not decrease with additional ranks of Planet Mapper).

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Plausible Deniability frrom Coercion and Deception check.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Plausible Deniability from all Coercion and Deception checks the character attempts.

ShortDesc: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at close range or engaged.
LongDesc: The character adds one damage per rank of Point Blank to one hit of successful Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) attacks made while at short range or engaged.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may perform Precise Aim maneuver. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Precise Aim, then reduce target's melee and ranged defense by that number.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Precise Aim maneuver before attempting a combat check and suffer a number of strain. The number of strain cannot exceed his ranks in Precise Aim. He then decreases the target's defense (ranged and melee) by one per strain suffered for that combat check.

ShortDesc: When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon. May suffer 1 strain to change the result to any Easy (:pu:) Critical Injury result.
LongDesc:
When the character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon, she may suffer 1 strain to change the result to any Easy (:pu:) Critical Injury result. 

Additionally, whenever the character defeats a minion or rival NPC, she may always choose to do so by nonlethal means, even if the environment or exceptional circumstances would normally make that very difficult or impossible.

ShortDesc: Once per round, when inflicting a Critical Injury with a Brawl or Melee weapon, may suffer 2 strain to change the result to any Average (:pu: :pu:) Critical Injury.
LongDesc: Once per round, when the character inflics a Critical Injury with a  Brawl or Melee weapon, she may suffer 2 strain to change the result to any Average (:pu: :pu:) Critical Injury result.

ShortDesc: Once per session, when inflicting a Critical Injury with an unarmed attack, may suffer 3 strain to change the result to any Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Critical Injury.
LongDesc: Once per game session, when the character inflicts a Critical Injury with an unarmed attack, she may suffer 3 strain to change the result to any Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Critical Injury result. Combat checks to activate this talent cannot be made with any weapons.

ShortDesc: When making a Brawl check against an opponent, instead of dealing damage, may deal equivalent strain plus additional strain equal to ranks of Medicine (this ignores soak).
LongDesc: When making a Brawl check against a living opponent, the character may choose to forgo dealing damage as wounds, instead dealing the equivalent damage as strain, plus additional strain equal to his ranks in Medicine. These checks cannot be made with any weapons, but this strain damage is not reduced by soak.

ShortDesc: Once per round, draw or holster a weapon or accessible item as an incidental.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, he may draw or holster an easily accessible weapon as an incidental, not a maneuver. This talent also reduces the amount of time to draw or stow a weapon that usually requires more than one maneuver to properly prepare or stow, by one maneuver.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter.
LongDesc: When performing a combat check during combat, the character adds • per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against any target that has not yet acted in the encounter.

ShortDesc: Suffer a number of strain to add an equal number of :suc: to lnitiative checks. Strain suffered cannot exceed ranks in Rapid Reacuon.
LongDesc: The character may suffer a number of strain to add an equal number of & to any Vigilance or Cool check to determine initiative order. The number may not exceed his ranks in Rapid Reaction.

ShortDesc: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.
LongDesc: When this character heals strain after an encounter has concluded, he heals one additional strain per rank in Rapid Recovery.

ShortDesc: Perform the Reconstruct the Scene action; make a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Perception check to identify the physical characteristics of a person present at the scene within 24 hours.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may perform the Reconstruct the Scene action. The character makes a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Perception check when present at a single crime scene (or similar location). If the character succeeds, she identifies all prominent physical characteristics of one person who was at the crime scene in the last 24 hours per :suc:.

ShortDesc: Once per session, may take a Redundant Systems action; make an Easy (:pu:) Mechanics check to harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one without breaking the first device.
LongDesc: With an Easy (:pu:) Mechanics check, the character may harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one, without breaking the functioning device. This allows the character to repair a broken device without having required spare parts, raw materials, or repair kits (the initial check does not suffer penalties for lacking repair kits, either). This only works, however, if the functioning device is at least the same size and technological level as the device being repaired (it is impossible to repair a starship with a blaster pistol, or a lightsaber with parts from a water wheel).

ShortDesc: Once per encounter, may take a Reroute Processors action; make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Computers check to reduce one of a droid’s characteristics by 1 and increase another of its characteristics by 1.
Remove :bk: per rank of Researcher from all knowledge checks. Researching a subject Lakes half the time.
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: per rank of Researcher from all Knowledge checks. Researching takes 50% less time (this does not increase with multiple ranks of researcher).

ShortDesc: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of 1.
LongDesc: When the character suffers strain, he suffers one less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of one. This does not apply to voluntary strain loss.

ShortDesc: May perform the Resourceful Refit action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Mechanics check to scavenge an old attachment to construct a new one, reducing its price by that of the dismantled attachment.
May downgrade difficulty of checks to interact with institutes of learning by one level per rank of Respected Scholar.
LongDesc: The character downgrades the difficulty of checks to interact with institutions of learning equal to his ranks in Respected Scholar.

ShortDesc: Take a Scathing Tirade action: make an Average (:pu: :pu:) Coercion check. Each :suc: causes one enemy in shore range to suffer 1 strain. Spend :adv: to cause 1 affected enemy to suffer 1 additional strain.
LongDesc: The character may take the Scathing Tirade action; making an Average (:pu: :pu:) Coercion check. For each :suc:, one enemy within short range suffers one strain. The character can also spend :adv:; for every :adv: spent, one target already affected suffers 1 additional strain.

ShortDesc: Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers :bk: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Coercion.
LongDesc: Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers :bk: on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to the character's ranks in Coercion; this does not stack with itself.

ShortDesc: Suffer 1 strain to perform Scathing Tirade as a maneuver, not an action.
LongDesc: The character may voluntarily suffer one strain to perform Scathing Tirade as a maneuver instead of an action.

ShortDesc: Once per encounter, may use Second Wind incidental to recover strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.
LongDesc: Once per encounter, the character may use a Second Wind incidental to recover an amount of strain equal to his ranks in Second Wind.

ShortDesc: Once per session, remove :bk: :bk: from any 1 check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may remove :bk: :bk: from any one skill check.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: to all Charm, Coercion and Deception checks unless the target is immune to Force powers.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: to all Charm, Coercion, and Deception checks unless the target is immune to Force Powers.

ShortDesc: During a chase, add :bl: per rank in Shortcut to any checks made to catch or escape an opponent.
LongDesc: During a chase, the character adds :bl: equal to his ranks in Shortcut to any checks made to catch or escape an opponent.

ShortDesc: Once per round, may perform Side Step maneuver and suffer a number of strain to upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by an equal number for the next round. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Side Step.
LongDesc: Once per round on the character's turn, the character may perform a Side Step maneuver to side step and try to avoid incoming ranged attacks. He then suffers a number of strain no greater than his ranks in Side Step. Until the start of the character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all ranged combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the strain suffered by the character.

ShortDesc: Choose one starship or vehicle as a Signature Vehicle. Upgrade all Mechanics checks made on that vehicle once.
Gain +1 ranged defense.
LongDesc: The character gains + 1 ranged defense.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.

ShortDesc: When making a Computers check may spend :tri: to make further Computers checks within this system as maneuvers.
LongDesc: When making a Computers check, the character may spend :tri: to gain some measure of control over the target system. Any further Computers checks within this system can be made as maneuvers.

ShortDesc: When first acquired, choose 1 skill: Charm, Coercion, Deception or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill, spend :tri: to gain additional :suc: equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.
LongDesc: When a character acquires this talent, he chooses one skill: Charm, Coercion, Negotiation, or Deception. When making checks with that skill, he may spend :tri: to gain additional :suc: equal to his ranks in Smooth Talker.

ShortDesc: Before making a non-thrown ranged attack, may perform a Sniper Shot maneuver to increase the weapon's range by 1 range band per rank in Sniper Shot. Upgrade the difficulty of the attack by 1 per range band increase.
LongDesc: Once per round before making a non-thrown ranged attack, the character may perform a maneuver to attempt a Sniper Shot. Sniper Shot increases the maximum range of his ranged weapon up to one range band per rank. For each rank beyond the normal maximum of the weapon, upgrade the difficulty of the check by one (this is in addition to the increased difficulty of the shot due to longer range).

ShortDesc: After making a successful attack, spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Cunning to one hit.
LongDesc: After making a successful attack with a non-starship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Cunning to one hit of the successful attack.

ShortDesc: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.
LongDesc: The character repairs + 1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a vehicle or starship.

ShortDesc: Cannot run out of ammo due to :des:. Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.
LongDesc: The character does not run out of ammo on a :des: . Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.

ShortDesc: When directing NPC droids, may grant them :bl: per rank of Speaks Binary on checks.
LongDesc: The character grants :bl: per rank of Speaks Binary to any tasks he directs a nonplayer droid to perform.

ShortDesc: When directing NPC droids, those droids grant additional :bl: in addition to other benefits.
Once per encounter, may perform the Speaks Binary maneuver. A number of NPC droids up to ranks in Speaks Binary may use the character’s ranks for 1 skill of character’s choice.
Add :bl: per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Stalker to all Coordination and Stealth checks.

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Willpower or Presence checks until the end of the encounter.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to ignore the effects of ongoing Critical Injuries on any Presence or Willpower related checks until the end of the encounter. He still suffers from the injury itself.

ShortDesc: Take the Stim Application Action: make an Average (:adv: :adv:) Medicine check. If successful, 1 engaged ally increases 1 characteristic by 1 for the encounter and suffers 4 strain.
LongDesc: The character may take the Stim Application action. To perform this action, he must have access to drugs, a medpac, or stimpacks. He makes a Average (:pu: :pu:) Medicine check. If successful, one ally he is engaged with (including himself) increases one characteristic of the character's choice by one for the remainder of the encounter, and suffers four strain. A single character's individual characteristics may each only be increased once by Stim Application during an encounter.

ShortDesc: When performing Stim Application Action, may increase difficulty of check to Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:), and target only suffers 1 strain.
LongDesc: As an incidental, when performing the Stim Application action, the character may increase the difficulty of the Medicine check to Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) as an incidental. If he does so, the target of the action suffers one strain instead of four.

ShortDesc: When performing the Stim Application Action, spend :tri: to increase an additional Characteristic by 1.
LongDesc: When performing the Stim Application action, each :tri: may be spent to increase an additional characteristic by one.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.
LongDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Street Smarts from any Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks the character attempts.

ShortDesc: Once per session, make one skill check using Intellect rather than the characteristic linked to that skill.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character can choose to make one skill check using Intellect, rather than the characteristic linked to that skill. When he does this, he must explain how, in this particular instance, his intelligence is helping him overcome this challenge.

ShortDesc: When making Melee checks, may inflict damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.
LongDesc: When making Melee checks, the character may choose to deal damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.

ShortDesc: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, may spend :tri: to stagger target for 1 round per :tri:.
LongDesc: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, the character may spend a :tri: result to stagger his target (see page 218) for one round per :tri: spent.

ShortDesc: Gain +1 melee defense.
LongDesc: The character gains + 1 melee defense

ShortDesc: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals I addilional wound per rank of Surgeon.
LongDesc: When this character makes a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals one additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

ShortDesc: Do not suffer usual penalties for moving through difficult terrain.
LongDesc: The character does not suffer the penalties for moving through difficult terrain (he moves through it at normal speed, without spending additional maneuvers).

ShortDesc: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Agility to one hit.
LongDesc: On a successful attack during combat with a non-starship/ vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Agility to one hit of the successful attack.

ShortDesc: Reduce time needed to complete Computer-related tasks by 25% per rank.
LongDesc: For each rank, the character reduces the amount of time needed to complete Computer-related tasks by 25%.

ShortDesc: May add 1 additional hard point to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once.
LongDesc: The character makes one piece of equipment more modifiable. He chooses one piece of equipment and increases its number of hard points by one. He can only do this once per piece of equipment, but can modify a number of pieces of equipment equal to his ranks in Tinkerer. If he loses a modified piece of equipment, he may apply Tinkerer to a new one.

ShortDesc: Once per session, add :bl: :bl: to any 1 check.
LongDesc: Once per game session, the character may add :bl: :bl: to any one skill check.

ShortDesc: Gain +2 wound threshold.
LongDesc: The character increases his wound threshold by two per rank of Toughened.

ShortDesc: Count vehicle or starship piloted as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.
LongDesc: Any vehicle the character pilots counts as having a silhouette one lower than normal when being attacked, to a minimum of 0.

ShortDesc: May Parry while unarmed. Reduce strain cost to Parry while unarmed by 1 (to a minimum of 1).
LongDesc: The character may perform the Parry incidental while unarmed. When the character performs the Parry incidental while unarmed, reduce the strain she suffers from the Parry incidental by 1, to a minimum of 1.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.

ShortDesc: Add :bl: per ranks of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.
LongDesc: The character adds :bl: per rank of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.

ShortDesc: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental; produce a previously undocumented item or weapon (with restrictions) from a tool belt or satchel.
LongDesc: The character may spend one Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental to produce a previously undocumented—but essential—small tool from his utility belt, satchel, or pockets, with a rarity no greater than (4). This cannot be a weapon unless the weapon has the Limited Ammo 1 quality.

ShortDesc: Remove :bk: per rank of Utinni! From checks to find or scavenge items or gear. Such checks take half the time.
LongDesc: The character removes :bk: equal to the character's ranks in Utinni! from checks made to find or scavenge items or gear. These checks could include Negotiation, Perception, or other checks, depending on circumstances  and the GM's discretion. Such skill checks take half their normal time (this does not decrease with multiple ranks of Utinni!).

ShortDesc: Choose any 2 skills. They permanently become career skills.
LongDesc: The character chooses any two skills. They permanently become career skills.

ShortDesc: When selling goods legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.
LongDesc: When he sells legal goods to a reputable merchant or business, the character gains an additional 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal (based on the original sell price of the good or item).

ShortDesc: When incapacitated, perform Against All Odds action; making Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Resilience check with :wh: equal to Force rating. Heal wounds equal to :suc:, spend :ldsp: to add :suc:.
LongDesc: Once per session, if the character is incapacitated due to exceeding his wound threshold, he may perform the Against All Odds action (this action may be performed even though characters are normally barred from performing actions when incapacitated). The character makes a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Resilience check, rolling a number of :wh: equal to his Force rating as part of the check. If successful, the character heals wounds equal to :suc:. The character may spend Force points :ldsp: to add :suc: to the result.

ShortDesc: Once per session, perform a Hard (:pu: :pu: :pu:) Lightsaber check to decrease the difficulty of all Negotiation checks for the rest of the encounter by 2.
After making a check to craft a potion or talisman, may suffer strain up to twice ranks in Alchemical Arts. For every two strain, add :lsp: or :dsp: to results.
Develop long-term bond with single animal of silhouette no greater than half Force rating rounded down.
LongDesc:
Through the Force, the character with which he is currently interacting. This cannot be done during structured encounters. This animal must have a silhouette equal to or smaller than half the character's Force rating when the bond is created, rounded down (this means a character with Force rating 1 could only bond with a silhouette 0 animal). The bond persists as long as the character chooses it to, although at the GM's discretion, the bond may also be broken due to abusive treatment or other extenuating circumstances. 

As long as the bond persists. the animal remains near the character, and the controlling player dictates the animal's overall behavior (although, since the animal is only bonded with the character, not dominated, it may still perform certain inconvenient actions such as scratching furniture, consuming rations, and marking territory). Once per round in structured encounters, the character may spend one maneuver to direct his animal in performing one action and one maneuver. The animal must be within hearing and visual range of the character (generally medium range) to do this. Otherwise, the animal does not contribute to the encounter. The specifics of its behavior are up to the player and GM.
